consequences: 12 investors were induced to part with more than $1.8 million

what: Pleaded guilty to six cheating charges related to the cryptocurrency investment scam
cause: Wang Xinghong was involved in the scam as the chief technological officer of A&A Blockchain Innovation
consequences: Wang Xinghong was sentenced to five years’ jail and received around US$100,000 from his involvement in A&A

main_event: Wang Xinghong developed an app for the scam
what: Developed an app which investors could use to purchase A&A “tokens” to invest in the mining scheme
cause: Wang Xinghong was engaged by Yang, the chairman of A&A, to develop the app
consequences: Investors were deceived into believing they were receiving daily returns from their investments

main_event: Investors suffered a total loss of around $1.1 million

consequences: Investors lost their money, and some were paid returns using money from other investors

title: Dinosaur diplomacy: What you need to know about China’s ‘renewed emphasis’ on fossil research
main_event: China's renewed emphasis on fossil research
who: China, Chinese paleontologists, American paleontologist Thomas Stidham, David Goodman from the University of Sydney
what: China has been focusing on dinosaur research, leading to numerous discoveries and advancements in the field
cause: The success of Chinese paleontology is credited to the discovery of 'Peking Man' human fossils in 1927, which sparked interest and growth in the field
consequences: China now produces the largest number of newly discovered extinct species of dinosaurs in the world, and its research and findings are having an increasing global impact

main_event: Discovery of numerous dinosaur fossils in China
what: Discovery of a large number and diversity of dinosaur fossils across China
where: Various locations in China, including Sichuan province and the province of Gansu
cause: China's renewed emphasis on fossil research led to extensive exploration and excavation activities
consequences: China has been recognized as a Jurassic treasure trove, with the number of fossils and new species discovered showcasing the rise and advancements in Chinese dinosaur research

main_event: Discovery of the Sinosauropteryx, the first-known feathered dinosaur
who: A fossil hunter named Li Yumin
what: Discovery of the Sinosauropteryx, a small carnivorous flying dinosaur and the first-known feathered dinosaur
cause: The extensive fossil research and excavation activities in China led to this discovery
consequences: This discovery added to the diversity of dinosaur species discovered in China and contributed to the understanding of dinosaur evolution

main_event: Challenges faced by the field of paleontology in China
who: Chinese paleontologists, Chinese universities including Peking University, Zhou Zhonghe from the Institute of Vertebrate Palaeontology and Palaeoanthropology (IVPP)
what: Challenges such as the illegal collection of rare fossils by poachers, declining enrollment rates for paleontology courses, and language barriers that limit international presentation of research
cause: Various factors including the perception of paleontology as an advantageous career rather than a field of personal interest, and limited English proficiency among researchers
consequences: These challenges could potentially hinder the progress and global impact of Chinese dinosaur research

title: One of a kind: How three Singapore professionals carved out niche careers
main_event: Rayann Condy becomes an intimacy coordinator in Singapore
what: Rayann Condy, a theatre veteran, becomes an intimacy coordinator in Singapore, working on local productions such as Pangdemonium’s staging of the play Who’s Afraid Of Virginia Woolf? and Mediacorp’s period boxing drama The Last Bout.
cause: Rayann Condy began studying for her certification at the start of the Covid-19 pandemic and completed her certification from Intimacy Directors and Coordinators, the largest organisation that trains and certifies intimacy professionals worldwide.
consequences: Rayann Condy becomes one of a very small group of professionals who take on intimacy coordination work in Singapore, possibly the only one with a formal, Sag-Aftra-accredited certification.

main_event: Paul Goh becomes a violin bow-maker
what: Paul Goh, a former student and teacher, becomes a violin bow-maker, crafting bows for Western stringed instruments.
cause: Paul Goh, dissatisfied with his career in education, decided to pursue his interest in music and craftsmanship. He enrolled in the bow-making department of the Violin Making School of America in Utah, where he learnt the craft of making modern bows.
consequences: Paul Goh becomes the first and only archetier in Singapore, with a waitlist of at least a year for his handmade bows.

main_event: Sam Wu becomes a certified water sommelier
what: Sam Wu becomes a certified water sommelier, offering masterclasses and tasting experiences, and importing and supplying bottled water to hospitality businesses and consumers.
cause: Sam Wu, dissatisfied with his work in his family's apparel business, found interest in the complexities of water after watching a video by water sommelier Martin Riese. He enrolled in a two-week water familiarisation course at the Doemens Academy near Munich, Germany.
consequences: Sam Wu becomes a certified water sommelier, slowly building a customer base and forming partnerships with businesses such as Marina Bay Sands and Restaurant Fiz.

title: US says challenges posed by China exceed those of Cold War
main_event: US Deputy Secretary of State Kurt Campbell's statement on China's challenges
who: US Deputy Secretary of State Kurt Campbell
what: Stated that the challenges to the US posed by China exceed those of the Cold War
where: House of Representatives Foreign Affairs Committee hearing, Washington
cause: Increasing global competition between US and China, and China's support for Russia's defence industry
consequences: Call for increased speed of US naval shipbuilding and capacity of the US defence manufacturing base

main_event: President Joe Biden's administration's stance on China
what: Explicitly stated that it is not seeking a cold war with China
when: Since the beginning of Biden's administration
cause: The escalating global competition between the two superpowers
consequences: Analysts and members of the US Congress have said escalating global competition between the two superpowers resembled a new style of cold war

main_event: China's Xi Jinping and Russia's Vladimir Putin pledge a 'new era' of partnership
who: China's Xi Jinping and Russia's Vladimir Putin
what: Pledged a 'new era' of partnership and cast Washington as an aggressive Cold War hegemon
cause: Increasing global competition and tension between US, China and Russia
consequences: Increased support between China and Russia, with China supporting Russia's defence industry and Russia supporting Beijing with submarine and missile technology

title: Treasury says US warning to banks slows Russia financial flows
main_event: US Treasury Department's threat to sanction foreign financial institutions
what: Threatened to sanction foreign financial institutions
cause: US Treasury Department's attempt to prevent Russia from circumventing sanctions imposed over its invasion of Ukraine
consequences: Significant decrease in financial flows between Russia and countries such as Turkey, the United Arab Emirates and Kazakhstan

main_event: Decrease in financial flows between Russia and other countries
who: Financial institutions in Russia, Turkey, the United Arab Emirates and Kazakhstan
what: Decreased financial transactions with Russia
where: Russia, Turkey, the United Arab Emirates and Kazakhstan
cause: US Treasury Department's threat to sanction foreign financial institutions
consequences: Disruption or slowing of payments for imported oil and Turkish exports

main_event: Bank compliance departments taking the executive order seriously
what: Started taking the executive order seriously and requested meetings with the US Treasury Department
when: After the executive order was issued in December
cause: The executive order threatening sanctions on financial institutions doing business with Russia
consequences: Banks sought to ensure they maintain access to the US dollar

main_event: US imposed extensive sanctions against Russia
what: Imposed extensive sanctions against Russia, targeting more than 500 people and entities
cause: Retaliation for Moscow's invasion of Ukraine and the death of Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny
consequences: Increased pressure on Russia's economy and political landscape

title: Singapore shares close flat amid mixed regional trading; STI dips 0.03%
main_event: Singapore stocks slipped into slightly negative territory
what: Trading of stocks resulting in a slight dip
cause: Mixed regional trading
consequences: The Straits Times Index (STI) inched down by 1.24 points or 0.03 per cent to 3,794.92

main_event: Hong Kong shares jumped, while bourses in mainland China were largely down
who: Stock traders in Hong Kong and mainland China
what: Trading of stocks resulting in a rise in Hong Kong and a fall in mainland China
cause: Government announcements of more fiscal spending next year following weak price data
consequences: The Hang Seng Index was up 2.8 per cent, while the Shenzhen Stock Exchange Composite Index was down 0.4 per cent

main_event: China’s consumer price index slowed for the third consecutive month
what: Slowdown in the consumer price index
cause: Economic conditions in China
consequences: The Chinese central bank is expected to keep its easing bias
